titleStmt.title: Non-Intrusive Gaze Tracking Using Artificial Neural Networks

analytic.title: Non-Intrusive Gaze Tracking Using Artificial Neural Networks

abstract.p: Dean Pomerleau pomerleau We have developed an artificial neural network based gaze tracking system which can be customized to individual users. Unlike other gaze trackers, which normally require the user to wear cumbersome headgear, or to use a chin rest to ensure head immobility, our system is entirely non-intrusive. Currently, the best intrusive gaze tracking systems are accurate to approximately 0.75 degrees. In our experiments, we have been able to achieve an accuracy of 1.5 degrees, while allowing head mobility. In this paper we present an empirical analysis of the performance of a large number of artificial neural network architectures for this task.
